newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka to introduce four-year treasury bond.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka to introduce four-year treasury bond.

text.p: Sri Lanka will begin issuing four-year treasury bonds later this month, a statement from the Central Bank said on Thursday.
"The Central Bank is planning to launch a four-year treasury bond in the third week of May," it said.
The initial issue of 500 million rupees will be made on May 15, at a coupon rate which is yet to be determined, the statement said.
"The coupon rate would be decided soon and announed to the market in time for the auction," it added.
The Central Bank said it expects the new bonds to be received favourably by the market, going by the success of the two-year bonds introduced earlier this year.
Two-year bonds were introduced on February 27, with 500 million rupees worth of bonds auctioned every two weeks.
The coupon rate of the two-year bond, which began at 14 percent per annum, had eased to 12.96 percent by the fifth issue on April 29.
The Central Bank said the issue of treasury bonds was the first step towards developing Sri Lanka's long-term debt market.
